fields.summary: Upgrade guide needs to include info related to EUCA-9377

comments.body:
[~tony], can you work with [~tvo] to detail what steps are needed to manually sync the keys? Let's also define when in the upgrade process this task should be done (needed before another step? Or as a last step in the upgrade processs?).

Thanks.

Hi Scot,
If I want to reference a command line, do I use a screen shot, or is there
a tag for a command line? Here is an example of a screen shot of a command
I want to drop in the topic:
[image: Inline image 1]

If I use a screen shot, is there a graphics directory I need to save the
files to?

Please set me in the right direction!
thanks,
tvo


On Wed, May 14, 2014 at 10:57 AM, Scot Marvin (JIRA) <

We just use text for command line examples.

All such text goes in <codeblock> element. If you're using this in a task
topic, you have to wrap the <codeblock> in an <info> element. For example:

<step>
  <cmd>Enter this command:</cmd>
  <info>
    <codeblock>Sample command</codeblock>
  </info>
</step>

For the second line in a command block, you have to make sure it goes to
the left margin. The <codeblock> element assumes all spaces or tabs in the
content are how you want it to look.


On Wed, May 14, 2014 at 11:19 AM, Thanhnguyet Vo (JIRA) <

On Wed, May 14, 2014 at 12:36 PM, Vic Iglesias <vic.iglesias@eucalyptus.com> wrote:
For the second piece there I would rerun the registration step rather than manually syncing with rsync. Namely:

euca_conf --register-sc -H <host-ip> -C <same-component-name-as-before> -P <same-partition-name>
euca_conf --register-walrus -H <host-ip> -C <same-component-name-as-before> -P <same-partition-name>
euca_conf --register-cloud -H <host-ip> -C <same-component-name-as-before> -P <same-partition-name>

-----------------------
On Wed, May 14, 2014 at 11:22 AM, Tony Beckham <tony@eucalyptus.com> wrote:
Scot-

Upgrade is the same as before with these additional steps:
Once the CLC is up need to register UFS and set object storage provider
euca_conf --register-service -T user-api -H <UFS HOST IP> -N API_<last octet of HOST IP>
euca-modify-property -p objectstorage.providerclient=<riakcs,ceph-rgw,walrus,s3>
If the topology had remote Java components (SC and/or WS not collocated with CLC) Keys will need to be synced to those hosts because new keys were added for OSG
On the CLC run:

rsync -avz /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/* -e ssh root@<remote java component host IP>:/var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/
As far as I've noted thus far those are changes for upgrade from 3.4.2 to 4.0 (which is the only upgrade path we support) let me know if you need any help or more information. 

--
Tony

---------------------
On Wed, May 14, 2014 at 11:10 AM, Scot Marvin <scot@eucalyptus.com> wrote:
Hey Tony,

Are there any changes to the installation commands for 4.0.0? Or is it just the registration commands?

And are there any changes to the start commands? Are the USF started together? I assume it's not using 

service eucalyptus-cloud start
[~tony], please let [~tvo] know the new sequence for upgrade here such that [~hspencer], [~dshekhawat] and [~lwade] can comment and verify.  Thanks!
[~tjcramer], roger that. [~gholms] has added a new command to sync keys. I'll get [~tvo] a final sequence when I test it out tomorrow.

Tony,
Does the above steps replace all the steps in the previous set of
instructions? In other words, do we no longer have to register User-Facing
Services (UFS) and set the object storage provider?
euca_conf --register-service -T user-api -H <UFS HOST IP> -N API_<last
octet of HOST IP>
euca-modify-property -p
objectstorage.providerclient=<riakcs,ceph-rgw,walrus,s3>

Thanks,
tvo


On Fri, May 16, 2014 at 3:42 PM, Tony Beckham (JIRA) <

[~tvo], the steps in [my previous comment|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/DOC-1229?focusedCommentId=70364&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-70364] are what should be added to the docs. I'm not sure what previous steps you are referring to. Registering UFS is step #1, setting objectstorage.provider is #2. Now we use the euca_conf command to sync keys rather than rsync or re-registering (as [~viglesias] suggested). I added #4–the install image worker part–as that will need to be done as well.

Gotcha!
I'll update the topic accordingly. Thanks for the clarification!

[~tvo], [~smarvin]:  [~hspencer] brought up a really good point today, in that for those upgrading from a release prior to 3.4.2 (let's say 3.1.2) we don't explicitly have pointers to those procedures.  In our upgrade section could we put a note something along the lines of:

Note: If you are upgrading from a release prior to 3.4.2 you'll need to do a step-wise upgrade.  For example, moving from 3.1.2 to 4.0.0 you'll need to upgrade in the following sequence:  3.1.2 -> 3.2.2, then 3.2.2 -> 3.3.2, then 3.3.2 -> 3.4.2, and finally 3.4.2 -> 4.0.0.   Here's the individual links for upgrade from 3.1.2 and on:
   Upgrade from 3.1.2 -> 3.2.2
   Upgrade from 3.2.2 -> 3.3.2
   Upgrade from 3.3.2 -> 3.4.2

[~tjcramer], you tell [~hspencer] to stop having good ideas that make more work for documentation.

(Great idea. I'll get the content in there.)
[~tvo] just volunteered to put the content in. Thank you, Ms. Vo.

Entry in 4.0 Known Issues of the Release Notes.
ref: ../release-notes/4.0.0/4.0.0_rn_issues.dita.

Added topic for sync keys on java components in the Upgrade section of the Installation Guide.
ref: ../install-guide/sync_keys_components.dita
